Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good Visit”
Reviews.Author: WimberleyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel before an early morning flight. I was a little concerned because it an "old school" design with colors and furniture from the 1970's. I ended up having a very good stay. All of the staff were very friendly and customer-focused. The airport shuttle is very convenient and fast. My biggest surprise was the restaurant. I enjoyed a delicious dinner. I recommend you give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Booked at Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: pshurd
Reviews.Content: We made a quick trip to Baltimore and needed to overnight near the airport. I used HotWire and got an excellent deal on the Sheraton BWI Airport Hotel. It was absolutely excellent. The room was quite large, clean, & functional. The bed was huge with great bedding. The service was quick & professional. The airport shuttle was prompt with a friendly driver. And to top it off, the bar had a nice selection of wine for our unwind drink. Would definitely recommend, especially with the nice price through HotWire!

Reviews.Title: “Room service was very good and fast!”
Reviews.Author: soapsales
Reviews.Content: Stayed this past week for one night. It is on the BWI property. Check in was fast and courteous and the room was very nice. Room service for dinner and breakfast were delivered in under 15 minutes and the food tasted great. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly T
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here while visiting a local college. It was our first visit to Baltimore. We found the Four Points to be a great, convenient place to stay and would definitely stay here again. Location and Transportation-We wanted a place close to the airport due to an early departure and this hotel is the closest to BWI (less than a 4 minute drive in the shuttle). We relied on the shuttle system to get around, and it did not disappoint. The driver's were helpful and friendly. They explained where to get the light rail and how to get back to the hotel from the light rail station (simply call the hotel for a pick up). I could not have asked for more convenient transportation. The hotel also arranged for a taxi to take us to the college open house because the light rail does not start running until 11:00am on Sunday. Room-The room was basic and clean. The carpeting could have used a cleaning, but overall, the room was very clean. The bed and pillows were comfortable. Internet was free. Michener's Restaurant-The hotel restaurant is down a set of stairs in the lobby. The staff is fast and efficient. The food was good....nothing fantastic, but good, enjoyable food. The bread they give you while waiting for your meal was excellent....worth a trip to the restaurant on it's own! Although we did not get the full Sunday brunch because we were in a bit of a rush, it looked good and there was plenty of food from which to choose. The only drawback to the food situation, really, was that they do not start serving room service until 6:00am. We had to leave by 5:15am and had room service been available earlier, we would have ordered it. Just a minor inconvenience. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay. The Four Points definitely knows how to cater to the airport/business crowd and makes your stay very easy. I cannot say enough about the transportation system. It was just myself and my daughter traveling alone, and the hotel staff made sure we knew exactly where to go to catch the light rail and the shuttle back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationfoodlover
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel at the airport that also provides parking for your trip. They have a nice restaurant, great bar with good appetizers and it's very clean. The hotel staff was very pleasant and very accomodating. My friend left her bag on the transport to the airport. The hotel staff was wonderful. They searched the room and transport, located the bag and got it to her immmediately for the trip. Nice option to Philadelphia!

Reviews.Title: “Average airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: cober6711
Reviews.Content: This is an average airport hotel. Nothing excellent but nothing terrible either. Room was decent but I didn't like the odd layout of the hotel because it took forever to get to my room. Bed better than the Aloft but not as good as the Westin. Didn't use the restaurant. Didn't get to use the pool because of its limited hours. I'd still probably choose the Aloft over this place given that their rooms all have fridges, which I believe are a must given my multiple night stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great DC alternative”
Reviews.Author: BiztravelguyBoston
Reviews.Content: If you pay for your own hotel expenses like me, you'll appreciate this hotel as a viable alternative to the hotel scene in DC. Located adjacent to the airport, they have frequent shuttles to both the terminals and the train station. DC's Union Station is a $6 one-way fare and takes about 30 minutes from the BWI Rail station right down the road. You can save a couple of hundred dollars a night by staying here and taking the MARC train down to DC. The hotel itself is 2 stories high, has what looks to be a nice outdoor pool, and has a restaurant on site (I did not eat here). Rooms are very comfortable, the shower is fine, the bed great. Free wifi throughout the hotel. As others have noted, you can hear planes taking off depending on the time of day - and you can also hear doors closing/people taking in the hallway from time to time, so if you are a very light sleeper and/or you are trying to sleep during the day, you might struggle here. Staff is friendly, shuttle service tremendous (far better than most). All in all a very good stay for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to airport. Fast van service, about a 4 minute trip to/from BWI terminals.”
Reviews.Author: BostonDaveQ
Reviews.Content: Four Points pricing Sheraton Service. Hotel was super friendly, checking was easy. Room was immaculate, heating/ cooling was quiet and ample. SPG guests are treated like royalty. Resturant downstairs was very good, service was good. Open late with full kitchen. Van ride was quick and easy, this was far from your typical airport hotel. Really a very short and pleasant stay. Ask for a room close to the front desk, and they will deliver, if available. Room service was also avail though I did not use it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location next to airport, but seriously needs updates.”
Reviews.Author: Susan Z
Reviews.Content: We spent one evening in Baltimore after a couple of days in Washington D.C. and chose this hotel because of close proximity to BWI Airport, since we were flying out the following morning. Personnel were pleasant enough, and at first sight, the rooms appear okay. However, all of the "systems" (heating, plumbing, bedding) need serious updates. The heat in the room did not work well, despite a serviceman having been sent right away to try to make adjustments. The plumbing squeaked and either dribbled out or came out ferociously...no compromise. The beds and pillows were extremely uncomfortable, and the linens were not soft. There was a large Valentine's Party taking place there the night of our stay, creating a problem with parking and quite a bit of noise that night as well. After having to drive around the parking lot a few times only to find a parking spot quite far from the front door, the front desk person just said, "Sorry, but it is because of the Valentine's Party". All in all, the hotel definitely has location adjacent to the airport going for it, but the rooms really need updating. I cannot comment on the restaurant since we did not partake.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any closer to BWI than this.”
Reviews.Author: prch
Reviews.Content: You are right at the airport, and they have a shuttle that will pick you up at the terminal and drop you off there, as well. Because you're so close, you do get the noise of the planes, so light sleepers should consider that. Not a problem for me. I ate dinner on site when I arrived, and it was excellent. Had a nice spinach salad and two amazing crab cakes. I also ate breakfast there the next morning. They had a buffet for $13, and it was average. From check in to the restaurant to the guy who drives the shuttle, the staff are all courteous, friendly, and welcoming. My room was on the small side, but nicely appointed. Flat screen TV, king sized bed, and a desk to work at. The Wi-Fi was excellent. I've flown through BWI dozens and dozens of times over the years, and never stayed here before. It will be one of my top options from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Utahparkslover
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed one night at the Sheraton BWI Airport and had a wonderful experience. Fatima at the reception desk had a warm and friendly smile and processed our check in quickly. We had a nice, clean king size room with a marble bathroom. The pub has lighter fare meals (appetizers, soups, sandwiches etc.) which we liked. The main restaurant has a plentiful breakfast buffet with the little extras like fresh fruit (strawberries, pineapple, melon, etc.), 6 different oatmeal toppings, and eggbeaters and turkey sausage (along with regular eggs and bacon) for those more health conscience. I don't remember the gentleman's name who assisted with our check out but he was also very friendly. Best of all - the whole hotel must be sound proofed because we never heard the planes.

Reviews.Title: “Good for going to downtown Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: PolybiusSon
Reviews.Content: Hotel was virtually on the tarmac of BWI (which had us confused upon first driving there and having to go through arrivals). Nice distance away from downtown Baltimore if you don't like the lack of parking downtown. Rooms were nice, with a nice TV and a comfortable bed. They were even able to give my buddy and 2 doubles as opposed to the 1 king we reserved. Restaurant was in the basement and the food was OK (only went because everything else was closed). Pool looked nice but had no time to swim in it. Would stay here again if flying into Baltimore; if driving, I'd try to find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: PioneerValley
Reviews.Content: Yet another business trip for me (the first week of December 2011) so I can honestly say this hotel is set up for exactly that. It's conveniently located very close the airport (there is a shuttle service available though you MUST use the convenience phone inside by the baggage claim to let them know you've arrived for pick up) so you're not stuck riding about looking for the place after you've landed. As this is a 4 Points hotel, they have those wonderful Sheraton sleeper beds so you're guarenteed a good night's rest. There is a bar and restaurant on the premises and room service is offered as well, but be advised that if you do lunch in there, the menu, though stocked with super tasty crabcakes and the like, is very limited. I'm saying this because we had a vegetarian in our group who kind of got sick of ordering the same two things from the lunch menu after a few days. Please note, though, that the food is very good and that the dinner menu is a bit more expanded in offerings. If you chose to go offsite for meals, there isn't anything in safe walking distance (by safe, I mean that the area itself if safe but there is a large criss-cross of busy roads leading to and from the airport that would require lots of courage and not very many brain cells to traverse so it's wise to either find other transportation out). The hotel shuttle will bring you to the nearest train station so that you can catch public transportation to the harbor front or other shopping areas. Be advised that you can take a local taxi but it's not cheap. A ride to the harbor area will cost between 15 and 20 dollars, despite the fact that it's not terribly far away. It may be the way to go, at any rate, if you have cabin fever and don't want to try to figure out the local public transportation tables at the the train station. Just FYI. A little gift shop is also onsite selling stuff like magazines, chocolate, t-shirts or any forgotten item you might need at a moment's notice. They also have a tiny fitness center if you feel the need to burn off those crabcakes you ate (a treadmill, an elliptical and freeweights as well). FYI: since this hotel is so close to BWI, you will hear aircraft taking off and landing. It's not screechingly loud (I live near a military base so it's not really a big deal for me) but you can hear them. If this kind of thing bothers you, you may want to find something farther out. The rooms are very clean with wi-fi available and the usual cable tv offerings. The only bugger for me was that there isn't really a quiet way to shut the doors to the rooms so every time someone left, the door would slam and that can be a pain when all the party animals are returning to their quarters at 1 in the morning and you have get up early the next day. Finally, the hotel staff was awesome. From the extremely helpful people at the front desk, to the cool room service folks and to Collette and the ladies in the gift shop and the rest of the staff, they couldn't be more pleasant. I would stay here again without a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Great place to stay. Very professional staff, excellent restaurant with in house chef.”
Reviews.Author: 33to1
Reviews.Content: I would stay in this hotel again without hesitation. So close to the airport, super convenient shuttle service. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The restaurant was excellent, and their in-house chef was great. I recommend upgrading to the top level club, worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Food at Restaurant & Bar, Good Conference Center, but Sleep Elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: wrg113
Reviews.Content: Recently, my boss and I spent the night at this hotel while attending a conference in the same building. The food at the restaurant and bar was outstanding. We both ate like Kings. However, the "King" size bed in each of our rooms was lucky if it was Queen size. My feet hung off the end and I'm only 5'9". If you removed the huge cushions that dominated the head of the bed, then your pillow wanted to fall into the exposed abyss between the headboard and mattress. HD tv was great, which I needed because of my inability to sleep on my munchkin bed. The hallway was a little noisy and the door seemed flimsy. In the shower, the rubber mat and the shower head were in need of replacement (gross!) and it was lower than normal causing me to crouch down to get my hair wet. I felt like Gulliver. The bathroom door was close to the toilet which made it so you definitely had to close the door to use. The other things that were annoying was that it was difficult to find the entrance to park, the view out the window was of a parking garage, and there is literally nothing to do. The hotel is an island in the middle of nowhere. My boss couldn't even procure a cigar! Our choices were internet surf, sit in the lobby and watch tv, or drink in the bar and watch tv. As far as a conference center, however, they get an A+ for the food, service, and conference room provided for our business meeting. They did an outstanding job in this respect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot”
Reviews.Author: deb47td54
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights wating to go on our cruise. Great spot hard to get into but once you find them once it's fine. Try their wings they were great

Reviews.Title: “Very Uncomplicated”
Reviews.Author: Georgiaboy62
Reviews.Content: Tey lived up the the the words advertised, I arrived at 1 am, a small line but the agent moved it along quickly, I was there on a stopver before moving into the city, my 4th Sheraton Hotel on my 3 month business trip. he room ws spacious and well maintained. As a Preferred Guest my room had been assigned and was waiting for all day and I guess I made someone work hard for no reason. I felt bad because I placed a wake-up call for 5am to get to my next hotel in the city. Since I arrved late the bar had closed but room serice was stillavailable but i decided to gt to bed. Not sure what the bed was called but it was sure comfortable. Sorry I cant remember anyones name at the hotel but I was tired.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport location”
Reviews.Author: Summer88
Reviews.Content: With a free airport shuttle, clean rooms with comfortable beds, I think this is a fine place to spend the night before an early morning flight. But the place is quite dark with very low ceilings. I felt trapped.we ate in. He hotel's restaurant which is in the basement. There wasn't a single window. The service was very good and the food ok. Tv selections were great and there was free wifi in the room. We got a queen bed room for $67 and felt that. Was a good deal. I wouldn't want to spend much mor than that to stay here. There were lots of convention rooms there and it appeared that many seminars were taking place on site. I wouldn't choose a place like that to have a convention but it is great if you have an early flight at BWI.

Reviews.Title: “Close to BWI”
Reviews.Author: GR8TRAILBLAZERFAN
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend this property.....the staff was great and very helpful, but the property was less desirable. Only 2 floors and Long winding halls, as well as very long walk from the elevator made the room difficult to find. As a woman checking in late at night, it was not a great experience. The room had only 2 plugins under the desk....NO PLUGINS ON THE ENTIRE WALL OF THE BED made it difficult to charge my phone etc. Beds were comfy enough but I would never want to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “My Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia B
Reviews.Content: Everything about my stay at the Sheraton BWI was awesome from beginning until the end. Check in was a breeze. I knew we would be arriving at the hotel very late that evening and when we arrived it was as if they were waiting on me. The hotel lobby was very inviting and relaxed. The room was excellent!!! I truly wanted to buy one of the pillows in the room but didn't want to sound silly at checkout so I didn't. I will be staying at the Sheraton for years to come and look forward to staying very soon...Cynthia Bovain DeLardge

Reviews.Title: “Most Convenient, Great Airport Hotel, Save on Airport Parking Fees”
Reviews.Author: askjens
Reviews.Content: We had gotten this 3-star airport hotel at a 1-star rate through Priceline's name your own rate - and was a little concerned about the room. What a pleasant surprise: while the long hall carpets were not new, everything in the comfortable room must have been totally updated just recently. Excellent bed, full scope of amenities, free fast internet and the room was totally quiet. Outside our room's window we only saw lawns (no airport roads) even though this hotel is only a 5-minute shuttle ride from the busy terminals. Shuttle picked us up within minutes after I called from the baggage area (ask near which terminal exit door their shuttle van pulls up). Front desk staff was VERY friendly, nice bar and restaurant downstairs. Too bad, we had no time to use the huge outdoor Olympic-size pool. We could have even saved the costly airport parking fee in the adjacent BWI Daily Parking Garage by leaving our car for up to 7-days in this hotel's outdoor lot, totally free when booked at published room rates, or only $30 a week when booked at the bargain Priceline bid rate. We will use that the next time.

Reviews.Title: “As Close to BWI Airport As You Can Get”
Reviews.Author: moviegal226
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive about staying at a Four Points but this is a very nice property! Ample free parking and super close to BWI Airport (in fact, this property is considered the "Airport Hotel" and you can literally see the parking garage and the tarmac / runway from your room). As a result of this close proximity, it can get a bit noisy from the airplanes. Our room was clean and well appointed and appeared to have been recently renovated. We checked in very late at night and the front desk staff was busy but friendly. We requested extra pillows and the housekeeping staff brought them within 5 minutes! The hotel has a restaurant on-site and they have late hours. You can view all arriving / departing flights right on your in-room t.v. too! The bed was comfortable, the room was clean and I had a good night's sleep. This is a great choice before or after a flight.

Reviews.Title: “VERY noisy”
Reviews.Author: smg873
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel on priceline for 1 night before a flight home from BWI. Hotel looks nice enough, front desk staff was friendly, but the soundproofing between rooms is nonexistent. It's midnight and I've spent the last 2 hours listening to the family in the next room as I try to fall asleep. They do not actually seem to be talking all that loudly, but it sounds as though they are practically in the same room. At least my kids finally managed to fall asleep despite the noise. All in all, I can't recommend staying here - at least not if you actually want to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay before flying out!”
Reviews.Author: dshebest
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice for 1 night for early am flights out of BWI. Very convenient. Staff are responsive and friendly. The shuttle drops you off right where you need to be and you can leave your car parked in their lot for up to 7 days for $30 while you are gone! Rooms are clean and comfy. Main lobby area also clean and newer looking. The hallways to rooms show their age. It's nice to unwind in the downstairs bar after arrival. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Boo for the bar staff!”
Reviews.Author: rrwalters
Reviews.Content: According to the "manager" it is Starwood Hotel policy to have sports or news playing on their big screen TV. EVERYONE in the bar wanted to watch the season premier of "The Amazing Race" and EVERYONE was denied. I thought the goal of hospitality services was to make the guest feel welcomed and appreciated. Not at this bar! I even had a penny thrown at my feet, intentionally, without due cause, from the bar manager! because other patrons at the bar kept revisiting how rude it was to not honor the request of patrons soliciting this particular bar. Don't recommend at all. No one here smiles except for the desk clerks.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average- Only for early morning flights”
Reviews.Author: MTCB
Reviews.Content: This is a very average property- old and showing it. While I wouldn't call dirty I was definitely checking sheets and beds. Noisy from both planes (no insulation) and other toilets flushing. Also rooms are VERY small so a two bedded room fits only two beds nothing else! if more than two people you should consider getting a second room or better staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but a bit noisy-not from planes either”
Reviews.Author: PuertoGal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently and found the hotel to be comfortable and the staff very nice.The room itself was nice--comfortable bed, clean, wireless service with lots of outlets for computers. It's not just close to the airport-it's at the airport but you don't hear planes taking off or landing.The noise we did hear---all night--was the sound of flushing toilets. Seriously--these toilets were like industrial toilets in terms of how loud they were. Also, expect to hear all the doors slamming shut at 5 a.m as travelers leave to catch their flights. For the price ($90 for king on a Friday night) we'd stay here again and just bring some earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a night”
Reviews.Author: malibert
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after a late arrival to BWI on a very rainy night. The staff was professional and the room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is on the airport grounds but not walkable from the terminal so you still have to wait a while for a shuttle to come get you. I was confused by the front desk at check in on how to get to the train station in the morning but the morning staff and the shuttle driver were very helpful - it was very quick to the station and turned out to be a very convenient hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: James S
Reviews.Content: Although the room was small, the bed was very comfortable. It is a great place if you need to be close to the airport(just next door). The in house restaurant was very good--try the crab cakes. Overall, a good value

Reviews.Title: “Decidedly Average”
Reviews.Author: billybobbiff
Reviews.Content: Nothing special but what do you expect from an airport hotel. Two negatives for me: the accumulation of room service trays lining the hallways, they have got to have a rodent issue with that, and the long trek from the lobby to the room - with misleading room number placards. There are other hotels just a mile or so from BWI that offer free shuttle service. Might want to check those out before booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A 'cookie cutter' Hotel, ideal for early flights. Nothing special here!”
Reviews.Author: Steveandchristine
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides average accommodation convenient for BWI. A frequent shuttle runs to all airlines. The room was clean, modest in size and average in amenities offered. The pool looked attractive, and a lifeguard was on duty. In the basement is a bar and restaurant. This probably only survives because of the location of the hotel. The food was mediocre and the wait staff were devoid of personality, with the exception of Tom, who was trying to be convivial. After a night here a 0630 flight seemed attractive!

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: tweaves
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located minutes from the BWI airport which is great if you have an early morning flight. The rooms are a little dated but they are comfortable with free wi-fi. The airport shuttle runs 24/7. The breakfast buffet was really good and they offer a nice selection of fresh fruits, waffles, eggs, and more! I plan to stay here again in a few days on my return trip.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay if you have an early flight”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen0803
Reviews.Content: It was clean, service was ok. Food wasn't all that great. Not a place I'd want to stay for any length of time, but it's at the airport, the bed was comfortable. The room was a little small, but for the price it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Skip it and stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: hardiehar122874
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton BWI as a park, sleep, fly on 8-13-11 and although the rooms appeared to be nice the stay was actually far from what we had expected. When we arrived the ladies working the front desk were to engrossed in their conversation to check us in before completing it and we then had to return to the front desk to complete our parking pass because the lady failed to realize that our reservation included it. The room and shower were very nice but the bed was far from comfortable. The airport shuttles are on demand which made getting to the airport Sunday morning quick and easy. However, when we returned after midnight the following Saturday we waited over 25 minutes after calling for the airport shuttle and had to call a second time (the hotel was only 5 minutes away). The driver, who was parked several doors down, arrived flirting with a female passenger who he then dropped off at the bus stop before taking us back to the hotel. This was irritating to say the least and extremely unprofessional. There are a lot of other park, sleep, and fly hotels in the area and I recommend people stay at one of those.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location if you have an early flight out of BWI”
Reviews.Author: Dawn C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after my flight back to Hartford was cancelled and I couldn't get another flight out until the next day. The courtesy shuttle picked me up minutes after my request, which was a relief as it had been a long day trying to get on another flight standby. The check in process was quick even with a long line of people in similar situations to my own as quite a few flights were canceled due to weather. The hotel is dated, but the room seemed to have new furniture and a nice flat screen tv. The bed was amazingly comfortable. My room was right next to the executive suite and had adjoining doors on both sides. I was a bit freaked out that the adjoining door to the executive suite did not have a deadbolt or any sort of lock on my side. I did prop the chair up against it for my own piece of mind. I am sure this is probably the only room with this situation, perhaps they used it for larger events they have in the executive suite? I ordered room service around 10 PM, and had my order by 10:20. The food was good, but I wish there had been a bit more selection on the menu. There is a bit of a noise issue because you could hear every door that opened in the hallway, but at least it ensured I was up early enough to catch my flight. Checkout was a breeze and the shuttle was waiting to take me back to the airport. It was an unplanned stay, but worked out pretty well.

Reviews.Title: “Right out of the 1980's”
Reviews.Author: brilliantseas
Reviews.Content: The Four Points by Sheraton BWI Airport reminds me of just about any nondescript airport business hotel from the early 1980's. This could have just as easily been an older Marriott or a Holiday Inn. I chose this property because it was relatively inexpensive (about $70/night via Priceline) and provided free shuttle service to the train station for easy access to both Baltimore and DC. The lobby of the hotel is large, yet the low ceilings make it feel somewhat dark. Around the corner sits access to the outdoor pool courtyard and the hotel's conference rooms. The hotel's guest rooms fill multiple two-story wings that surround the pool courtyard and most have either a view of the pool courtyard or the massive parking decks of the airport next door. This hotel really is the closet hotel to BWI airport. Just make sure you go right instead of left when turning into the hotel or you'll end up dead-ending into the expensive airport parking garage rather than the free outdoor lot of the Four Points by Sheraton hotel. My wing of the hotel lacked an elevator, so I was forced to carry my luggage up the stairs to my 2nd floor room. The hallway on the 2nd floor felt almost claustrophobic, with old, dark carpeting and ceilings that could not have been more than 7 feet high. At 6'3", I nearly hit my head on the exit sign coming out of the stairwell. The rooms themselves are clean and feel slightly more modern than the rest of the hotel, with a nice desk and free internet access, however the low popcorn ceilings provide hints at the hotel's age. Room service is limited, and there are no restaurant options outside of the hotel lounge within easy driving distance from the hotel. I opted for an $18 cheese pizza one night because I was too tired to get back on the highway and drive to a different exit in search of an Applebee's or even a McDonald's. No free continental breakfast at this property, either. The one big plus to this hotel was the free shuttle to the Amtrak/MARC train station, which provides easy access to both downtown DC and Baltimore, with continuing Amtrak service to New York City. Very convenient and much more affordable than paying for a hotel and parking in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: MMM1515
Reviews.Content: At first I was very impressed with the hotel. They let us check in at 11:30 AM, though we had to get a room with a king bed, instead of 2 doubles. There were cups and other items under the bed when we arrived, so the cleaning staff obviously missed a few things. The pool was just ok, nothing incredible. The "gym" had one bike, one treadmill and one elliptical, which made a horrible noise when you used it and a few weights. Restaurant was overpriced and the food was not great. The service was very slow, despite having only 2 tables of guests and numerous staff members standing around talking. The issue I had revolves around the credit card that they charged the room to. I used one card to hold the room but I was very clear at check in that I was planning to use a different card to pay for the room at check out. I had a reciept with the correct card being charged, yet they still charged the original card. Also, my 1 year old daughter slipped and cut her lip open and I had to use two hand towels to stop the bleeding. I was charged $20.00 for the towels, which were rough and cheap! The office staff was rude when I called with my complaint. I would never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but very difficult to get to”
Reviews.Author: FemaleTraveler85
Reviews.Content: This is an OK hotel for one night before you leave from BWI. It is rather difficult to get to. Neither my GPS nor mapquest.com directions got me right there. The good news it that once you are near where those directions take you, you can see the hotel and just roam around until you find the entrance! Comfortable bed and room. Added touch is they had a dehumidifier in the room that you could turn on at your discretion. It is very humid in Baltimore in the summer. I didn't think I would need it, but I did, and it had filled up and turned itself off sometime in the night. Glad I turned it on - much better sleeping conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz, but good enough”
Reviews.Author: Steve G
Reviews.Content: I had a fairly good experience at the Four Points. Yeah, it's probably seen better days, but I've definitely stayed in worse - and ones that were more misrepresented by the hype. We arrived to see a rather crowded lobby, full of members of a church convention. They were all dressed to the nines, and having prayer circles, so it wasn't like an unruly crowd or anything. I think this hotel only has two floors, with rooms sprawled out over a relatively large area. It took quite a bit of walking to get to our room, but that was okay, because I think the distance kept us away from the noise of the convention goers. The room was a little small, but otherwise it was clean and attractive. it looked like an older room that had been refurbished. The air conditioning worked well (it was a HOT day), and thankfully so, because the extra dehumidifier in the room was broken. Still, we were more than comfortable in the room, and with the air cranked to max, we never heard any noises from the other guests or the nearby airport. We decided to eat dinner in the small downstairs bar, since we concluded that the holy rollers were probably not going to be drinkers...and we were right (the few of them who came in ordered a soda or juice). With the light crowd, service was friendly and quick. We had a crab soup that was to die for (I'd almost go back just for the soup!), along with a filling chicken quesadilla. The drinks were tasty, and they even had a couple of decent brews on tap. Like another reviewer stated, there is a very small TV behind the bar, which is a pain to watch, but in all fairness, there is also a large-screen TV on the side wall. But the best part of the Four Points is the convenience to BWI. We were leaving for a couple of days, so we left our car in their free parking lot, and took advantage of the free shuttle service. Unlike many airport hotels, the Four Points shuttle runs on demand, rather than on a fixed schedule. When you're ready to go, so are they! And they are really close to the airport, so it's maybe a 5 minute ride to the terminal. So to sum it up, the convenience was great, and the accommodations were good. I'd definitely consider returning for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a few rough edges”
Reviews.Author: Gandeeman60
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights the last weekend in July, and for the price I can't complain too much. I had several mix ups on the reservation, none of which were the hotel staff's fault. In fact the front desk staff were some of the friendliest, most helpful people I have encountered anywhere, and every single employee I met in the hallways spoke to me. The hotel is right beside the airport, close enough that if planes landing and taking off keep you awake, its not the place for you. However, its also only a 12-15 minute drive to downtown (or you can take the hotel shuttle to the airport terminal and catch the train into downtown). This is an older property that is showing its age in places, but overall was very clean. Our room was on the first floor right around the corner from the lobby, and was a bit noisy. There was a convention going on at the hotel and when people walked by the room talking, we could hear every word they said (especially annoying at 1am!) Our son stayed on the second floor and said his room was very quiet, so apparently location is important. I read in another review about the pillows on the bed that look extremely fluffy, but flatten out when you sleep on them...I have to agree, I was not a fan of the pillows. Overall, a good value for the money, and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything they said it would be!”
Reviews.Author: KEVNTRISH
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful. Room was clean & nice. The staff was great! We were given several idea's of places to visit while we were there by a very nice young man that worked at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hawk1tdh
Reviews.Content: Traveled to BWI to see my nephew and his wife's new baby! Stayed at this "smelly" hotel before flying home. The place stunk like mold and mildew because half of it is underground!! The rooms were renovated.....on the surface! But the rooms had a nice touch with a de humidifier in every room that sounds loike a jet engine taking off!!! You really do need it to because the Air conditioning does NOT work well!!! The Bar and restaurant is in the "basement" It was HOT and smelly down their too! The place is full of humidity and lord knows maybe a lot of mold!! No one their could give a crap less if you were not happy. The service sucked in the bar and restaurant. Oh and the 12" flat screen behind the bar wad a classic. Looked like my laptop hanging their!! $189 bucks later I was ripped off screwed bad and four points or Westin could care less!!! You can out lipstick on a pig but its still a pig!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK.”
Reviews.Author: msflyingsolo
Reviews.Content: I don't expect much from airport hotels.. and this is no exception. A bit dated in design, with claustrophobically-small bathrooms, but very pleasant staff and clean rooms. The restaurant/bar area is a bit dark since its below standard ground level, but the food I had was good (hard to go wrong with crab when in Maryland!). There's not much good or bad to say - this is just an ok hotel, at rates appropriate for an ok hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip...Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SassySabby
Reviews.Content: I will start off by saying that the reviews are correct that the hotel is a bit dated and probably should be renovated again.This hotel however had the friendliest staff EVER. What the hotel lacks in being new and modern is made up for by its award winning staff and their knowledge of the Baltimore/DC area. The drivers of the shuttle service are quite knowledgeable in getting you back and forth to the DC area if you want public transportation(but don't use if if you have more than six going to Greenbelt if you have your own cars). Our family was here this 4th of July weekend. The property is literally located on the airport property and on Sunday night we played the airplane game. We had 3 double rooms on both floors and I never heard the planes until we came outside. The hotel has free parking and it appears some of the airport guest have taken advantage of it but there is parking on another side. The rooms varied in size for some reason. When we first checked in we had two large double rooms and one smaller double room. However the air went out in the room and they quickly moved us to one of the other larger double rooms.The smaller double room would have been fine ordinarily but it was six of us that came to town to visit family so every one was in and out of the others room and that was a bit cramped in the smaller room as it had less chairs. Over all we enjoyed our stay and I would stay there again because It was super convenient and the free internet was the best.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay at an acceptable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wayne042010
Reviews.Content: Looking for a wonderful pool with lifeguard, friendly staff, and a super restaurant? This is the place. Clean room, easy free parking, quiet hallways. Looking for a spacious bathroom? Keep looking. Everything else was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to BWI, but rooms need renovations”
Reviews.Author: HMRoch
Reviews.Content: Convenient location next to BWI with complimentary shuttle service. Front desk staff was friendly and accomodating, but guest rooms were old and in immediate need of renovations. Bed was very uncomfortable and room had feeling of not being as clean as it could be. I've definitely stayed in nicer Four Points!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: mac4216
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night for an early flight in the morning. I booked on line for the "free food" package. Check-in was quick and painless. I bought the parking permit for $30 - available if your stay or not. Shuttle was FULL get there early. Hotel is literally on the airport property. The evening food " hors d'oervres" was almost a regular sized meal and tasted great! Bartender also was server and was a bit over burdened with both. Had the buffet breakfast the next morning - awesome amount of food! Room was clean and comfortable. Had a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reximus4
Reviews.Content: Obviously you don't expect much from an airport hotel but....when I arrived at 1 am, there was a long line waiting to check in and only one hostess handling it. This is a major international airport and when I booked, they assured me that they were fully equipped for 24 hour service to accommodate passengers at all times. The room was clean. But it was boobytrapped with multiple alarm clocks going off at 4,5,6 am. Not kidding, and yes, this is highly unpleasant after a very late arrival. Finally, service was poor. They shut down room service at 12 am- though I had read online that 24 hour service was available.

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel -Very Nice Employees”
Reviews.Author: QueenBri222
Reviews.Content: I liked my room - it was small but clean and comfortable. The staff I encountered during the 4 nights of my stay were all very nice and accomodating. My only complaints would be A) the common areas could use updating - there was a somewhat unpleasant smell in the hallways but, I truly believe it was probably due to age. And B) the showers in the bathrooms should be fitted with doors instead of curtains - during each shower, there just wasn't enough curtain to keep from soaking the bathroom floor. Not the end of the world - just annoying.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: fitzgfamily
Reviews.Content: 2nd time staying here ,both times we have been very happy with our stay ,it has a very good shuttle service to and from the airport. Would use again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for outbound flights or short stay.”
Reviews.Author: Kaiona46
Reviews.Content: Check-in fast, friendly staff. The room was clean. Bed comfortable. Very convenient. I'll stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for outbound honeymooners!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinBon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night of our wedding before an early flight. Katie at the front desk was very sweet and upgraded us to a larger room, which we appreciated. Our friends came and joined us at the bar for some extra celebration. Good drinks, a free shot for the bride and groom, and basketball on the TV - we were happy. Comfy bed, I didn't notice any noise from the airport, and free shuttle was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed.”
Reviews.Author: Tampasmom
Reviews.Content: The room is a decent size although bathrooms on smaller size, but perfectly fine. My husband got here earlier but I did not fly in until midnight. The shuttle picked me up immediately, he was very nice. The hotel was a jump away, perfect! The rooms were nice. From some other reviews here we were worried we would hear noise, but heard absolutely nothing until a screaming child ran down the hallway the next morning, which I fully blame on her inconsiderate parents. The cost compared to other hotels close to BWI was great. My husband left the room to get a soda for me and left the door not quite closed, and the security person had the front desk call to tell me my door wasn't shut, which was great!

Reviews.Title: “Just Average- declining by the years”
Reviews.Author: cilneri
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this Four Points as far back as 2007 with some visits in between. The staff here is friendly and welcoming. Be sure to ask for a room that faces away from the airport, or good luck trying to sleep! This airport has an on-demand airport shuttle, which means that guests can request rides to the airport at any time. The rooms have been re-done and it feels like they are doing their best to keep this property going. Some minor gripes- on my most recent visit I had the pleasure of getting a room with the noisiest heating unit, supposed SPG room. After I complained and had a staff member verify, it took almost an hour for me to get re-assigned to another room, it was already pretty late at night. The F&B, especially the bar downstairs, is a joke. I don’t think I’ve ever had a meal there, in which one part of my meal didn’t have a problem (previous visit before last was broken draft beer tap, this time multiple selections were not available). I cannot help but think everytime I walk through this property, would Four Points be better off at a new location? Just walking through the hallways makes one feel incredibly claustrophobic and looking from the outside, one could easily mistake this place for a motel!

Reviews.Title: “Not an upscale sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Travelendad
Reviews.Content: Went to Sheraton airport for a night of swimming with the kids and perhaps an in room movie. Nice staff. Building feels a little worn down. Rooms are redone, and fairly nice. Sheraton website says in room movies but they don't have the system. It had snowed and they made little effort to clean their lot

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality all around”
Reviews.Author: esotericsilhouette
Reviews.Content: Four Points by Sheraton provided my family and I with wonderful service, a relaxing stay, and a clean friendly environment. Specifically, Tina who worked at the front desk was very helpful when it came to checking in and finding good tourist spots to visit. All of the porters and drivers were very helpful as well, where they were friendly and punctual. Lastly, the hotel dining at Micheners restaurant had wonderful fine dining with delicious entrees and great service. All around the hotel was more than satisfactory but outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Four Points are Back on track”
Reviews.Author: ronapenn
Reviews.Content: This is a mid tier hotel and I rated it accordingly. It is above average in that group. the hotel was re-done a couple of years ago and the public areas and rooms are attractive and comfortable. We avoided for Points for years because they were all dumps, but lately the ones we have tried, have improved immensely. The restaurant is good and serivice is good, but not exceptional. It is our regular hotel in the area; we stay there about 3 times a year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: nycgeorgian
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Friendly, professional staff. Comfortable room/bed. Room service way better than most and not expensive. Real turkey (real turkey!!) in the club sandwich. All around really good and close to airport/rental card place.

Reviews.Title: “Near the airport, but that's all.”
Reviews.Author: arvjho22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near or at the compound of BWI airport. They have shuttles that pick you up or take you to the airport, but I rented a car so I didn't need that service. From the car rental, the hotel is hard to find the first time. Your GPS will tell you to go to the Daily Parking airport garage, but actually make sure you make a right turn before you enter the garage. The hotel is a pretty small building, and it doesn't look like a hotel. So just keep your eyes open. The best aspect for this hotel is that it is near the airport, otherwise it is just an ordinary hotel. It is also an old building but with modern furnitures and flat panel TV. The room is very clean, but since it is an old building there is a lingering smell that is hard to explain. Bathroom is clean. You also get complimentary breakfast. For the price, I think it is expensive because it is near the airport. But for the quality I think it is too expensive. They have a restaurant, but if you eant to go out to eat, the nearest fast food is a couple miles away. Because of the price I will not stay at this hotel again. I would rather drive a few miles to get to the airport and stay at another hotel that is newer and have places to go at night. If being at the airport is important to you, then this is good for you. But that's not important to me. Oh, and obviously there are airplane noise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what it is - an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mucciville
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we had a late flight getting in and a train to catch the next morning. It was perfect for what we needed. The room was very spacious and comfortable. Bathrooms spacious and well equipped (though a note to European travellers in general - you'll always find conditioner provided but you won't always find bath foam/gel in US hotels!) The location was quiet (albeit it being close to the airport). We had a good dinner at the restaurant that evening and a good breakfast the next morning. We also noticed the hotel had an exceptionally large outdoor pool so if you'll be hanging around here during the day, do bring a swimsuit with you! The hotel is a good 10 minute drive away from the airport (or more) but they offer a complimentary shuttle from the airport and to the AMTRAK station, which was perfect for us. We haven't stayed in any of the other BWI airport hotels so we can't compare, but in itself it suited our needs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: cookiebert
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made a quick trip to DC for one night, since we had a flight credit to use. We spent the day in DC and then stayed overnight at this hotel, since we had an early flight out of BWI. The hotel room was a good size, as was the bathroom. The service was quite good; there was no fridge in the room, and since I needed one to store breastmilk in, I went to the front desk and asked for one. Within 5 minutes, a fridge with freezer was delivered to our room, free of charge! Workout room was very small, with just 1 treadmill, 1 elliptical, 1 bike, and some free weights. Breakfast was free and awesome; nice buffet with cereal, breads, eggs, meats, waffles, and tons of fresh fruit and juice. Delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - awkward bathroom”
Reviews.Author: schupjo
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at this hotel was uneventful, staff was friendly, Room was clean and the shuttle service was available when needed. While the following is, a list of nuisances more than anything, but the only way that changes can occur is to let the Hotel know how your stay was – good or bad. •Design of bathroom is awkward – have to close the door to get into the shower •Towel rack was right above the toilet - which resulted in a towel falling into the toilet •Shower head was to low – water pressure was good •Desk and easy chair need to be facing the TV

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: lamarlafongCleveland
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and close to the airport, shuttle very prompt, never more than a 5 minute wait after calling. Rooms and bed very clean and comfortable. Food was great a wonderful breakfast buffet and delicious dinner. The staff was very friendly and when a couple of minor problems arose, the manager Kevin, took care of them without hesitation. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, beautiful room with great beds.”
Reviews.Author: n9
Reviews.Content: Easy access from highway, and lots of parking. Staff was super friendly and helpful, and the rooms were beautiful. We did not want to get out of the wonderful beds. I did not have a fridge in my room, but the AAA rate was worth it. Please do give this hotel a try, and if it is warm enough, take a swim in the pool. The whole pool area is clean, the pool itself is huge, and they have a real live lifeguard at duty.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: TBaez
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to baltimore, MD & our 2nd trip we used this hotel. We enjoyed it for one because we didn't have to deal with all the Baltimore traffic to get to our hotel. Another is because its not too far to get to the hotel from Baltimore. Only about a 10 min drive (including the traffic lights & other things while driving).

Reviews.Title: “Worked well for us”
Reviews.Author: Sun-N-Beach-Fun
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for one night during the first leg of our summer vacation and found it to be clean and comfortable. It suited our needs perfectly and was a good value at about $100 a night for the room we reserved (two double beds). We didn't spend a lot of time obviously so bear that in mind when weighing this review. Once our flight arrived, we called the hotel and they sent a shuttle to retrieve us. After a quick check-in experience with friendly receptionists, the shuttle returned us to the airport where we caught the Light Rail (the metro transportation system). Our destination? An Orioles baseball game. We returned following the game, showered and watched a little television before turning in. I will say that I got a little worried when, at about 10:30-11 p.m., some odd and very loud jackhammer-ish noises began emanating from somewhere within or nearby the hotel. I let it go for about a half-hour before I called the front desk to ask them about the source of the noise. The lady that answered the phone acted as if she was unaware of the noise. Rightttt. Then a voice behind her mentioned something about road construction nearby. Made sense. I just couldn't believe the hour at which said construction was taking place. Must have been an emergency repair? The hotel was full so we couldn't be moved (not that that would have helped) and no comp or credit was offered for our inconvenience. Turns out the noise lasted about an hour, which was just enough to get my blood pressure going while the rest of family snoozed obliviously. I finally did get some sleep and the noise wasn't an issue for the remainder of the night. Like I said, not sure if it was an emergency repair or an ongoing project, but I would definitely ask before booking. Aside from that little experience, all was well at this hotel. The complimentary shuttle to and from the airport, although probably not unique to this hotel, was also very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: atstpier
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good value if you want to be close to downtown without paying downtown prices. The rooms are pretty standard, but the deluxe room is quite large. The bathrooms are standard. The pool is very nice - large and deep. The lifeguard is a bit overzealous. He will keep you safe, but your kids fun factor may be diminished a bit. The restaurant is a very good value for breakfast. Overall I would recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms”
Reviews.Author: RenoTourist
Reviews.Content: We were here just one night arriving at midnight for a week long vacation to DC and we didn't want to travel that far at night to DuPont circle so we got a reservation at the Sheraton BWI. What a surprise, they picked us up at the airport within minutes, stayed with us while we located a lost bag, and put us into a standard room that was as good as the five star hotel we had in DC in terms of size and amenities (no service). In the morning they shuttled us to the bus to the DC metro and we have rarely had such value. Free coffee, flat screen TV and good sized bath. We didn't eat there but what a great stay. There is nothing in the area worth seeing, this is just a layover for those going elsewhere but a great place to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, fantastic deal”
Reviews.Author: tuffy0317
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the night before an early flight to avoid having to drive up to BWI from northern Virginia super early in the morning. We got a great deal on an AAA stay and park package that allowed us to stay for the night and then leave our car there while we traveled (up to 8 days). We were only gone for three days, but it was comparable to what we would have paid to park at the airport. The room was much nicer than expected, with a comfortable bed, nice desk/work area and a big flat screen TV. The bathroom was nicer than expected as well. The only problem we ran into was that the hairdryer didn't work, but they brought me a new one within 15 minutes of calling - at 5am! The shuttle service to the airport runs 24 hours and was very convenient. When we returned to pick up our car, the shuttle came right away after I called, even at 1am! I would not hesitate to stay here again if I had an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “They make it easy”
Reviews.Author: petesrLakeErieShore
Reviews.Content: When I asked if they could, they said "yes". When I asked if they would, they said "yes". When they asked if we liked it there, I said "yes".

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean. Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: beprov31
Reviews.Content: My husband and I selected this hotel for our Baltimore Inner Harbor vacation from 3/26/10 to 3/29/10 after reading TripAdvisor reviews. We found it to be very clean, well-maintained, and comfortable. The front desk staff was friendly. Parking's free. This hotel is the closest you can get to the BWI airport - from the parking lot, you can see planes on the runway - but neither of us noticed any airport noise. I saw reviews concerning noise from other rooms, but we didn't hear anything. The price was excellent, $85 a night after taxes (from Priceline.) The outdoor pool area also looked clean and well-maintained, though the pool wasn't open. We didn't try the room service or the restaurant. There is, however, a Dunkin Donuts in front of a Food Lion within a 5-minute drive. In-room movie was incredibly expensive at $15, but maybe that's to be expected of a relatively new release. The only disadvantage (and for some people it's not a disadvantage) was that this hotel is definitely not within walking distance of Baltimore. It's a 10-15 minute drive. Highly recommended, though. Plus, I found a quarter in a chair!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: TheShadow32
Reviews.Content: We had a late flight and the Four Points was able to accommodate our plans. The rooms were not overly large and the beds were fairly comfortable. The breakfast was just OK but better than Hampton or Holiday Inn. The location is the key here especially if you are traveling to BWI airport.

Reviews.Title: “Well managed hotel, fantastic restaurant”
Reviews.Author: spiderkitties
Reviews.Content: It's probably the closest hotel to the airport, very convenient with 24x7 shuttle service. Every touch point I had with the hotel employees was positive including front desk, housekeeping, and others. The rooms were nicely appointed, with very comfortable sheets and bed, free-wifi. The mini-gym and pool came very handy too. There were other nice touches too, such as free coffee in the lobby in the morning. My only complaint is with the sound proofness, or lack of, of the rooms. The people staying in the room next to mine had a very early morning flight, and decided to stay up all night to chat. Unfortunately, I could hear much of their conversation throughout the night through the thin wall. The restaurant completely exceeded my expectation. It had the ambience of a mellow jazz club, well attended but not too noisy. The night I was there, there was a young piano player playing mixture of jazz, classical and broadway tunes. Great player. The menu looked good with a wide range of choices and they were reasonably priced. Being a big crabcake fan, I ordered Maryland Crabcake for entree. It was by far the BEST crabcake I ever had anywhere. The entree came with a beautifully presented salad, and choices of freshly baked gourmet bread. Other dishes were equally well executed. The server was very efficient and pleasant. Overall, it was just a delightful experience. I wish I could fly in and out of BWI again just to dine here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GCGirl22
Reviews.Content: We had to stay at an airport hotel because my hubby had a very early morning flight. I was quite pleasantly surprised by this facility. Free parking - check. Free shuttle - check. Monitors in the lobby to see your flight status - check. Extremely helpful and polite staff - check. Heck, they even threw in a bottle of water in our room. The gym facility was small, but had very nice (WORKING) equipment. Our room had Wifi that was easy to jump on. All in all this facility provides very complete amenities for the price. It looks a little like a bomb shelter from the outside and our room was very clean and comfy. I gave them a 4 for rooms because the bathroom was not state-of-the-art-brand-spanking-new. It was still very nice and quite clean.

Reviews.Title: “WORST STAY EVER (They may have heavenly beds but the rest was HELL)”
Reviews.Author: flakeyskw
Reviews.Content: Noise thru out the night kept waking us up from an ice machine or someone working on the plumbing. NO WATER in the morning for our shower. When we called the front desk they said the only thing they could do was move us to another room. We told them that we would not have enough time to repack and move since we were now running behind to catch our flight. When we got to the front desk to check we never heard that they were sorry but only that they tried to rectify the problem by moving us. When I asked to speak to a manager I was told that he was not availible but I could call him later. On our return back from our trip to retrieve our car it took 3 calls to the hotel to get them to send the shuttle for us. We waited for 45 minutes in the cold for the shuttle and when the shuttle arrived the driver did not help us with our 5 bags.

Reviews.Title: “Average place, mediocore stay, not sure what all the good reviews are about”
Reviews.Author: MooneyPilot
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location if you need something at the airport. The negative is that it is an old hotel and I stayed in the "back" building and the planes sound like they land of the roof. It appears like it is an old motel that has been somewhat redone to make a newer look inside. The shuttle service was nice and fairly prompt. The restaurant was mediocore at best (and there are not other choices nearby), so you are stuck unless you want to spring for the $30 cab fare to downtown. The room was very, very small (less than 1 foot between the end of the bed and the dresser (barely wide enough to walk by sideways), the linens were low quality as well. My bed was not very comfortable either (there was a lump in the middle of the mattress, wo you had to lay on one side of it). On the positive side, the room had a decent tv and free wireless internet access. Negative side is that it was small, cheaply furnished, and uncomfortable. All in all, there are other airport hotels that have shuttle services and I would most like try another one if I needed to overnight at BWI again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and restaurant, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: MD-DCsuburbs
Reviews.Content: I attended a weekend conference of about 100 people. The conference facilities were very good as were the public areas. I can't remember any other hotel with staff which was as helpful and cooperative. The conference's banquet food was very good and its presentation was fine. For other meals, the restaurant laid on excellent, moderate priced small buffets in addition to their normal menu. The rooms were well refurbished. My room was quiet, although there was some airplane noise in the rooms on the airport side of the building. The WiFi covered the rooms but was quite slow. The hotel is a little hard to find since there are two Elm Roads at the airport and another Sheraton is in the nearby BWI Hotel Zone. The free shuttle to the airport terminal appeared to work well, though I didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Park, stay & fly all for one great price”
Reviews.Author: oshunreef
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sheraton Four Points at BWI due to an early flight the next morning. It was a wonderful king room. We also had free wireless internet. We booked this due to being able to be right at the airport and we could leave our car for a week for the park, stay & fly fee which was about the same or a very close price to our stay price anyway. There was a complimentary shuttle too and from the airport. It usually ran every 15 minutes. There is a very nice restaurant on site for dinner and a small bar downstair for a nightcap. If you are a light sleeper the airplanes are right next door. I always take earplugs and have no problem, but am a very light sleeper. If you book a room and are a light sleeper you can probably request one away from the back of the hotel. When we returned back from our flight the driver dropped us at our car. When my husband used the remote it didn't unlock. He left the lights on while we were gone so our battery was dead. The driver asked if everything was okay. He gave us a jump (we had cables) which probably saved us a few hours of waiting for AAA. He was a lifesaver after our journey home. Wish I could remember his name but was pleased by his service.

Reviews.Title: “Quite accomodating, a pleasure staying there.”
Reviews.Author: rickn32058
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this 4 Points while in Baltimore for a convention. Staff was polite, friendly and very helpful. We had need to use the courtesy shuttle daily and found that riding it to and from the Light Rail stop was easy and convenient. Room service, requests for extra blankets and pillows were answered promptly. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The walls are very thin.”
Reviews.Author: lsorren
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is as close as you can get to BWI without being on the runway. Noise is a problem, but, surprisingly, not from the air operations. Inconsiderate hotel patrons and a slow response from hotel management is the issue. We arrived late on a Friday afternoon. Tariq, the desk agent, couldn't have been better. He was very expeditious and went out of his way to make sure the check-in was as painless as possible. The room, a king, was small, but comfortable; well lit and adequately climate conditioned. The bed was comfortable and much appreciated. Breakfast, complimentary, was very good both in quantity available and quality. The hotels location to BWI can't be beat with a regular five-minute shuttle to the departure terminals (for transient guests) or to the light rail to Baltimore ($3.20 round trip, about 1/2 hour comfortable ride to Camden Yards). Pickup from the hotel at the light rail station was prompt when we called. And then the nightmare began. There was a wedding party booked in the same wing as we were. And the reception apparently was being held in our hallway, from 11PM on. We weren't invited. While we wished the happy couple well, all we wanted was enough peace to recover from a day touring Baltimore (great city, excellent attractions and food, etc.). The 100-meter dash, followed by marathon door knocking seem to be main events at this "reception", as well as some very foul mouthed women who seemed eager to consummate the marriage. It took us three calls to the front desk before security responded. We had to suggest they post a guard on the hallway to try and convince the wedding party to consider the well-being of the other guests. Bottomline, we will not stay here again, and cannot recommend this hotel to others. The staff of the Sheraton Four Points needs to be more responsive when there are obvious and repetitive violations of privacy that prevent the hotel from delivering its primary products: rest and sleep and hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but better hotels in the area”
Reviews.Author: SoxfanMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: Speedy check in and very, very friendly and helpful staff. Room smelled a bit musty and we had trouble with the toilet flushing and making noises during the night but the room was clean. The shower was also very small for a tall person. Walls must be thin because we heard all noises in the hallway when anyone walked by however the airport noise was only occassionally loud. We did not think the bed was comfortable given how it is promoted. Free breakfast buffet was much better than expected (given that it was free) and the service was fast and friendly. We were in the area for an event in the Harbor (easy to get to from this hotel) but next time we would probably stay in the nearby hotel area rather than at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and roomy.”
Reviews.Author: Solarsid
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight here on a business trip. Check in was very fast and helpful, clean and modern hotel with outdoor swimming pool and indoor fitness room. The room was clean and more than adequate, large bed and the obligatory HD TV. Proximity is very close to the airport, however, no disturbance from the aircraft. Also offers a complimentary shuttle service to the airport, all staff extremely helpful and accomodating. Would recommend if wanting to stay at airport overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay after miserable, delayed flight”
Reviews.Author: aDCtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night after a delayed flight arriving well after midnight -- too late to return to my home in DC safely. The hotel shuttle picked me up very quickly. The room had a comfortable bed, new decoration and TV. Free bottled water but no minibar. Room was quiet. Elevator and vending were located away from rooms. Pub that serves food was open late, not sure when it stopped taking orders, but locked the door soon after 1:30am. Free buffet breakfast was very good. Very large outdoor pool, good for laps and opens at 10am. Shuttle took me to airport to get bus back to DC. If you want to visit DC from BWI take the B30 Metro bus to the Green line metro station at Greenbelt. The hotel shuttle will take you to the bus stop at BWI and pick you up.

Reviews.Title: “Always Stay Here When In Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: nesso1
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Four Points everytime I fly through Baltimore. Their rooms are nice-sized and always clean. Their beds are soooo comfortable, and big enough for myself and my three kids! Their staff is friendly and very helpful. On my last stay, I was in the process of moving back to the states from overseas, and had my dog with me. She was crated, and their staff helped me with loading her at the airport, and unloading her all the way to my room. I recommend the Four Points to everyone who's travelling through BWI!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Experience!”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler1123
Reviews.Content: This place was great, the service was outstanding. I have stayed at dozens of hotels over the past 20+ years and this place had the best service I have ever experienced. We went to the area to visit DC and Baltimore for the first time, and this was the right place to stay. Although the highway system is a little confusing, it's easy to find by following the BWI signs. The shuttle was prompt and took us to the airport train station where we were able to ride the MARC train into the centrally located DC Union Station. Because it's on TSA property, the hotel area feels alot safer than most DC area hotels, and safety was a primary concern. When I checked in, I was assigned the wrong room, which was too small for my family. When I inquired about it, the front desk upgraded us to a larger room without question. Beware that for some rooms, the airplanes take off just a few hundred yards outside the window. We stayed in one of those rooms but it's really not that loud (my kids and I thought it was cool). We didn't try the restaurant (expensive high end food), and there are no restaurants withing walking distance, but the front desk has printed directions for other restaurants. Free parking very close to the hotel entrance. We will definately stay there again next time we visit the DC/Baltimore area. We found a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: CloneJessie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the airport property, so we weren't expecting much. Room was huge; there were two complimentary bottled waters and a gift basket waiting for us. We are gold level Starwood members, so your experience might not be the same. We had no problems with the hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware unreliable shuttle”
Reviews.Author: emetplay
Reviews.Content: On my 10 PM arrival from Amtrak station, only a 5-8 minute drive away, I waited 45 minutes for their shuttle! I called repeatedly and was told each time that the shuttle was on the way. My daughter arriving home from deployment in Iraq around 5AM had an identical experience. The next night after taking the light rail from the Inner Harbor to the airport, we encountered a similar delay in pickup by their shuttle. Just don't count on the hotel's shuttle for dependable service.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a decent & clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moonbeam720
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Baltimore & Annapolis, MD for our 1-year anniversary. We decided on this hotel because there was a special deal online, had free parking, wasn't too far from Inner Harbor (20 minutes) and 30 minutes to Annapolis. A weekend stay is all you need for this area. Lots of great places to eat. We ate at Obrycki's Crab House (pounding the crabs was a ton of fun but the area is a bit shady and the pepper on the crabs was a bit too spicy), G&A for chili dogs (+delicious fries with gravy), and Louisiana Restaurant (Cajun/Creole) - the duck was absolutely delicious. The hotel itself is pretty clean. Th bathroom is tiny and the hallway had a stale, musty stench. But it's right next to the airport. Overall, I would stay here again if I was back in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: cricketclub
Reviews.Content: You cannot stay closer to BWI as this hotel is closer than the remote parking lot. The exterior dates this hotel to the 1960's but the interior is nicely refurbished. Front desk service is gracious. The rooms were nicely appointed although I'd characterize the bathroom as small and ordinary. Beds were comfortable but not plush and sheets were thin. The dining room was attractive with decent food (dinner) and outstanding bread but was severely understaffed and service was slow. My biggest issue was the noise: I guess it is due to the original construction date because modern airport hotels are usually quiet. I could hear every plane (not really a big deal) and every conversation next door and every time someone nearby used water in their room (a big deal). Light sleepers beware.

Reviews.Title: “I would live here if I could”
Reviews.Author: seeya1234
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I've ever stayed at in my whole entire life. SUPER inexpensive, with WAY better quality than the Hilton and Marriott chains, Regular Sheraton, everything. I would move in. The staff is AMAZINGLY helpful. We flew into Baltimore at 11pm, had room service (AMAZING!) and jumped into bed. We woke up and had an incredibly cheap but wonderful buffet breakfast in their cute restaurant, used the FREE PRINTING in the business center and planned our whole trip before going to VA, D.C., and N.Y. We took the FREE SHUTTLE to the airport back and forth-oh it was so incredible. I wish all our hotels on our trip had been this great. It is just a straightforward, friendly, comfortable place for weary travelers. I will stay in Four Points by Sheraton anywhere I can find them from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value, Best Service, Best Food, . . .”
Reviews.Author: vbdave26
Reviews.Content: What can I say. I travel over two hundred thousand miles each year and spend an average of two to three nights in a hotel each week. The Four Points at BWI was by far one the most well run hotels that I have stayed in for quite a long time. The shuttle picked me up very quickly. The check in was flawless. An upgrade no less into one of the king suites. Nice bed, lots of extra space. I got in pretty late and had a good meal from the room service (truly a rarity). Had a great meeting, and then took shuttle to light rail for DC meeting. I really can't believe how nice the staff and service offered really was. Today, you just don't find this kind of hotel for the money. Only complaint was the feather pillow. Allergy. Will definitely come back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price, convenient, but wath out for the 'taxi'.”
Reviews.Author: AFumiere
Reviews.Content: We got a very good rate on the hotel through Soutwest Airlines's website. The hotel is perfect for arriving late or leaving early. The rooms were clean. Our problem came when we asked for a taxi to DC. I made it clear that I didn't want a car service, but a cab. When the driver showed up in a new black Suburban, I knew that I was being had. He didn't have a meter and wanted to charge me $100. When I said that that was too much, he became very aggressive. We ended up calling a local cab company, Liberty. By meter, it was $70 to the edge of DC and $85 to where we were heading on the other side of the city. Other hotel employees in DC try to work the same scam, but this example stood out because they tried it against my explicit request.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl63
Reviews.Content: Every time I have an early flight out of BWI I stay there. Always ask for their park and fly program rate. It is cheaper than rack rate. Even tell them if you are a Starwood Prefered member. You get good service. I have never had any problems with this location at all. I like the idea of leaving your car there and they will pick you up at the airport. Just tell them the location you are at the airport. The rooms have been re-done in the past yrs and are fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great for early flights!”
Reviews.Author: spivonious
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a night here in order to catch an early flight out of BWI. We took advantage of the hotel parking rate (still worked out cheaper than getting another hotel and parking in the long-term lot).
