We arrived around 7PM, checked in, asked about how the shuttle works (on demand only), and watched a little TV (high-def TV actually showing HD channels), showered, and went to bed. Plenty of hot water, good pressure from the shower head, and the toiletries were of good quality. The bed itself was the perfect balance between soft and firm; we both had a great night's sleep (or as great as possible when waking up at 4:30AM!). We got out things together, went out to the desk, and the shuttle pulled up less than 5 minutes later. The driver loaded our bags for us, we got in, and were dropped off at the airport less than 5 minutes later. Upon returning, we simply called the hotel to request the shuttle. It showed up within 5 minutes of our call, and the trip back to our car was uneventful. Overall, I'd recommend this hotel to anyone needing to catch an early flight. It's not the greatest location for Baltimore tourists, and there is slight airplane noise due to the proximity to the airport, but there was always someone at the front desk, and always in a very helpful mood.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey Hotel Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: ericboston
Reviews.Content: After just staying here this past January. I found this hotel to be extremely pricey. I paid over 200 a night to stay at this hotel rack rate with no discounts. I found there service at the counter to be poor, very slow. I found that they have only two sets of vending machines with no food at all. They have only one shop with limited hours. I had to ask security to use the employees vending because I was so hungry. There was problems. The nearby parking garage owned by the airport next door had a fire alarm problem. So the alarm in the middle of night kept going off waking people up. Secondly, I found there free shuttle service to be rude, arogent, and pathetic. I requested my bags be brought over from the hotel to the aiport. I waited nearly 20 mins. The service was extremely slow! The hotel overall was very close to mass transit. Not far from light rail to Balitmore, not far also to amtrak or trains to washington dc. The hotel offers shuttle to those around grounds of hotel. No free breakfast. There is a small restraunt but the food is very pricey. The rooms were auful. They need to be more organized. Free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed. My favorite BWI hotel”
Reviews.Author: fenwayman
Reviews.Content: I don't usually like to stay at Four Points hotels as in the past they have been disappointing. I think that the brand has improved in general and this BWI hotel far exceeded my expectations. I spent one night here. I can say that every contact with every staff member was a good one. The shuttle drivers were friendly and helpful. Check-in was efficient and polite. The wait staff at the restaurant were friendly and fast. The maids in the hallway always smiled and said hello. The room was huge. I don't know if I was given a special room as a platinum member of SPG, but it had a comfortable king size sleighbed, a couch, chair, coffee table, full dresser, and large HD flat screen TV. The bathroom was clean and average. The shower had plenty of hot water and good water pressure: after cleanliness, that's 90% of what I like to see in a bathroom. I had dinner and breakfast at the restaurant, and both meals were wonderful. I called for a shuttle pickup at the airport and was told it would be there in five minutes: it was. I asked the night before when the shuttle would be available if I had a 10:53 AM train, and they told me a time, and again, it was available when promised. Both shuttle drivers were friendly and funny, and offered to give me ideas for off-site sites to see. The fitness center has three cardio machines and a rack of free weights. There was not really enough room for more than one person to use the weights. It looks like they have a giant pool (for a hotel at an airport) but it was closed for the winter. I stayed at five BWI properties over the last two months and this one was the best value, and the one I'm going to focus on going forward.

Reviews.Title: “Old and smelly”
Reviews.Author: sonri
Reviews.Content: The building looked really old on the outside, but the lobby and restaurant were very nice. But once you head to the rooms it is a totally different picture. Stained carpet on the hallways, plates with old food everywhere on the floor, and very dark hallways with low ceilings that made me feel as if I was walking to a prison cell rather than my hotel room. The room was very, very small, with stained carpet like the hallway, a very outdated bathroom with rusted fixtures. The furniture was the only nice thing in the room; a big flat screen TV and nice bedding. But the room stunk and the AC unit would make loud noises in the middle of the night. Sort of like an old car breaking down. I ran out of there and found another place. (as if it wasn’t enough I got sick the next morning, I’m sure I caught something there)

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: modelmrw
Reviews.Content: My son and I enjoyed our stay. I was surprised how clean it was. It was very nice like I said bu I have found that the Sheraton resorts are nice hotels. Not a speck of dust or dirt anywhere and I am very picky when it comes to booking hotels and taking my son on vacation. The Inner Harbor was 15 minutes away. Very good price for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality with a Capital "H"”
Reviews.Author: Katbenn8
Reviews.Content: I've traveled all over the world and never did I expect to find the absolute best hotel experience right here in Baltimore. This hotel has sharpened their hospitality skills to a level which I've never encountered. Each and every employee is Helpful ( a family member got lost twice; each time they stayed on the phone to give her the driving directions back to the hotel), Happy ( you will see genuine smiles), Well mannered ( "Good morning", "welcome back ", "hello"), and most definately on their toes.. so much that I felt like I was the only guest. When does that ever happen? I'm a fan of Sheratons overall but the employees here made my visit so wonderful that I simply have to plan some vacation time to go back and visit my newly married niece ( I was there to attend her wedding) Yes, they are that impressive. So a big BRAVO to the General Manager, Kevin Carnes for his fantastic staff. Perhaps they are all working to emulate him. While I was checking in, he had finished up a meeting and walked over to welcome me, even carried my luggage directly into my room. Do you see why I felt like I was the only guest? The rooms are beautiful, comfy and quiet . The outdoor pool is refreshing & relaxing. The restaurant serves a breakfast buffet with every imaginable breakfast item on hand. We also dined in the Pub area; cold beer, burgers and yummy pies.To visit the Inner Harbor /Convention center or any other Baltimore attraction the train is in walking distance (to me) although they are happy to drop you off and pick you back up. Stay there... you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EWISE19
Reviews.Content: Well, when i arrived at the hotel, i was delighted by how comfortble the whole environment was. Eventhough it is very close, 0.3 miles, to the airport there is not too much noise from the airplanes. The staff at the front desk was wonderful and everytime I turned around someone was there to help me. The check in was very fast and easy as well. So when I got into my room, I couldnt help but notice how clean it was and smelled!!! Everyone is always worried about a clean room when picking a hotel and this room was top notch clean. There was plenty of pillows and plenty of room to move around. They also provide joinin rooms, which is lovely if travelin in groups or just with family. There was plenty of cups in the room as well as tea and coffee. The bathroom provided lotes of towles, shampoo and conditoner!!! Some hotels dont offer conditioner. There was also two different soaps, face and body. Anythin else you need you can get it from the front desk. I felt right at home in this hotel. There was a very nice sized pool, outdoor!!! i dont understand indoor pools...whats the point? lol!! The pool also has a life guard on duty, which was very classy of them. The bussines center was a lil small but there was plenty of computers around the hotel, with free internet(in rooms as well). Altogether I really loved this hotel and even though it has been around for quit some while it was by far the best hotel I have stayed in. I will deffinitly be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place!”
Reviews.Author: mrae1972
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here a few years ago and was not very impressed, but this time was MUCH better. They have remodeled and the rooms have been updated. Nothing too fancy, but it is clean and comfortable. I am pretty picky about cleanliness and comfort and this hotel passed the test. Room service food was very good . . ..try the peach pie! The outdoor pool area is large and clean with a life-guard on duty. I would've loved to spend more time at the pool! Excellent value! I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Early and Easy Flights”
Reviews.Author: 4CatFamily
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel often.I personally or my spouse and I fly everyother month..so in some ways this has been our home before travel since the mid 90's. Its great for early and easy flights. They offer a shuttle 24/7, let your auto there (park/fly), and when you arrive back just pick up the hotel bookings phone found at you bagage claim and call for a pick up shuttle they pick up on the inside curb so no hassle w/ outer loop traffic.The shuttle driver has always been nice and from time to time we get a driver who has had a bad day I guess if we had to make a % we have only gotten 3 w/ a bad attitude in all these yrs.They are helpful w/ laggage and keeping you abreast of the local or semi local news... The beds are soft, fluffy towels,extra if you need them..also ask the front desk for a wake up call easy ck out and in and the hotel has been up-dated (nice job!!). The pool is devine for summertime w/the fam or catching a few rays before your flight. The food is good..not cheap..a couple its great..as a family you might want to find a surrounding resturant..there are many.. Try their new micro brews from the Baltimore areas..kinda tastey..Crab soup is to died for !! The staff and the wait staff has always been very helpful and nice to work w/. Sign up for Starwood Rewards kinda nice to get a free night stay at any Sheraton and Four Points hotels. Also try booking through many different sources: the hotel direct,and use any AAA, AARP and Military or company sources to lower your rate. Book early and save more the rates have been from $79-$279. so scan the net and the hotel.The hotel is a few miles from attractions..and you do get some jet noise..but you are very close to the airport..you can see many major airlines take off to the left of the front entrance...the kids love it !!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: tetech
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton overnight for an early morning flight out of BWI. Because I was really only at the hotel overnight, I'll keep this review brief. Location: The hotel is an airport hotel, i.e. it is actually AT the airport, not in the so-called hotel precinct NEAR the airport. The 24-hour shuttle to the terminal is fast and convenient. Room: My room was clean, well decorated, and in nice condition. Heating/AC was responsive. Bed was very comfortable. Thumbs up for the room. Bathroom: Was a bit on the small side, and seemed more in need of renovation, but still nothing to complain about. Everything was clean and in working condition. Staff: Were friendly and efficient. Summary: If you're looking for a hotel with convenient access to BWI, based on my limited experience I'd recommend Four Points. I would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: jodcha
Reviews.Content: Stay here if Room is more important than Hotel Service to you. Room is nice. Bed is very comfy. House Keeping did a very good job. Room is clean. The moment I stepped into the room after I check-in, the room smelled stuffy, I guess it is because air condition was not on? However, the smell was gone really fast. But the corridor had a cigarette smell… Again, room is nice, I got a King bed room, it is spacious enough. However washroom is a bit small, good for 1 to 2 people only. Shower was very good, water is strong from shower head. I enjoyed my shower a lot! TV was nice, a lot of lighting in the room, bright enough. I like their working desk, there are wheels on one of them, plus there are enough seatings. However, they have no mini-fridge or microwave. Something I was not expected. I would give it a B to the room, but service, it would be a F! Most of the front desk staff are nice, but not to the standard. There is one guy that is just rude. Not only to me, but to everyone. I saw him yelling at other customers several times. We had a lot of people coming to Baltimore and I made a group booking with this hotel. The group sales lady is very nice, but really frustrates me. Again, is not to the standard. Being nice is not enough for good customer service, it also requires how they can solve my problems and respond to my questions. I have also encountered one of the managers of that hotel while I was making reservations earlier. Again, he was very rude to me on the phone. I feel that if the front desk, reservation and group sales staff can improve on their customer service skills, this is a fantastic hotel. I will be coming back to Baltimore later this year, I am hesitant to come back because of the bad customer service, even thou they have one of the best beds!

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Good for stopver”
Reviews.Author: Tripper21
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for a 24hr stopover - and spent most of that either asleep or in downtown Baltimore. Close to airport. free shuttle etc. Maybe 20mins to downtown Baltimore and harbour etc. Breakfast was fine, didnt sample restaurant. Efficient checkin and checkout, even though both were at odd times in middle of night and late evening. Would stay again for stopver or even if in downtown Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms and close to airport”
Reviews.Author: 2bytheshore
Reviews.Content: This is an extremely nice hotel very close to the airport. It has a free shuttle service to and from. We stay here everytime we fly out of BWI which is often. Never been disappointed. Beds are very comfortable and room is clean. I am very picky where I stay and I never hesitate with this place.

Reviews.Title: “More Than Descent”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine_Floridian
Reviews.Content: While not really elegant it is an very nice choice if you're flying in and out of BWI. There is a pub and a very large restaurant underground serving american dishes. The pub is not smoke free and I could also smell ciggarettes it from the lobby. You can tell it is an old hotel due to its low ceilings but it was recently renovated to include LG flat screen TVs in each room. It was difficult to get to but it is very close to the airport. But these were my only complaints. The rooms were a nice size and the beds were comfortable. Service was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great rooms|”
Reviews.Author: bostona
Reviews.Content: Only hotel located on airport grounds, shuttle service to the terminals, free parking, huge rooms, free parking. I stayed four nights as the rate was good and I did not need to be close to downtown, which, by the way, is a 15 minute drive away. I forgot my camera battery with the charger plugged in the wall. The housekeeping manager was so nice, I called him and he Fed Ex'ed it overnite at their expenses to my next hotel in Philly. Best hotel staff I've ever met!

Reviews.Title: “close to Airport, really close”
Reviews.Author: rickymartinaz
Reviews.Content: was here for a week on business, convenient as I was working at the airport, shuttle provided pick up and drop off at all hours. Rooms are a nice size, large bed, flat screen TV, not the best picture but hey. internet connection in room. all pros in regards to the business aspect of the hotel. staff was friendly, small fitness room. not much else in the area other than going to the airport. Restaurant was good, not great, high priced for what you get, but it is convenient. bar area is rather small, and can get crowded quickly. staff was receptive but sometimes in a daze as they would look right at you and ignore you and walk past, noticed that a few times with several guests. now the negatives are this is an airport hotel, that being said, you hear planes at all hours of the night, especially if your trying to get some sleep, not very helpful. The only solution I found was to listen to my IPOD, with in ear headphones that manages to drown out most of the noise. convenient for a short overnight stay but would not recommend for a longer stint.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: goinonaroadtrip
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay. The front desk staff and shuttle drivers/bellman were wonderful. At tentative, pleasant and prompt even with the hotel being very busy. My room was clean and everything was in working order. The complimentary bottle of water and the size and quality of the toiletries were a nice touch. The on-site restaurant was excellent. The food was fresh and served hot and the wait staff was top notch. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: mccouch
Reviews.Content: I had to book a 1 night stay in Baltimore for work. I was working near Security Blvd, but could not find any hotels in that area with encouraging reviews. I booked at the Sheraton Four Points BWI because of the positive reviews on TripAdvisor. Without a doubt, this property lived up to the reviews! I was thoroughly impressed, especially for the nightly rate I received through my business' travel agency. A previous reviewer said something to the effect of: "Finally, a hotel claiming to be remodeled which really *was*!" I couldn't agree more. Finding the hotel was easy, just drive to the airport and follow the signs indicating "Hotels." It took about 25 minutes to get from the Security Blvd exit on I-695 to the hotel. From the outside, the hotel is obviously fairly old; two-story, white brick, mid-century design. It didn't look too impressive from the outside, but the moment I walked in I was blown away. The lobby is nicely decorated and inviting. The front desk staff was professional, prompt, and courteous. One front desk employee actually admonished another who was momentarily ignoring another customer while finishing a filing task, saying "finish that later. Always attend to the customer first." My room was on the second floor, a decent walk from the front desk, but easy to find. The room was in perfect order when I arrived, with the heat already on (it was a chilly, rainy day). The room was very nicely decorated and had the much talked-about flat panel TV. There was a comfortable desk chair and a small but serviceable lounge chair, as well as two small ottomans (ottomen?) that could serve as seating. The bed was a very comfortable King. I was very pleased to see that the bottle of water on the desk was complimentary. My sleep was pleasant and restful. When I awoke, my folio had been slipped under the door. At checkout, the front desk staff simply asked if I had any questions and when I replied in the negative, she indicated that nothing else was needed to complete my checkout. My only two gripes about the room were (1) the HVAC unit was a little loud, but it did not keep me up, and (2) while in the shower, I got several warm and cool flashes of water. Not hot enough to scald, but a little surprising when they hit. This hotel will be on the top of my list next time I'm in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “The location and hotel itself were fine. The staff disrespectful”
Reviews.Author: chiptress
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Points Sheraton BWI for one night. We chose this hotel based upon several things. We are starwood preferred members, location and the reviews written here.While the hotel itself is perfect for airport travel the staff was the worst i have dealt with while traveling. Good points were the size of the king deluxe room and no airport noise. The bad points were dealing with Kevin Carnes the general manager and the bartender in the hotel. I have never in my life been treated with such disrespect. I will most likely not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room for price, but read on ....”
Reviews.Author: William6
Reviews.Content: I've used tripadvisor for a while now, but this is my first time writing a review. Our Four Points room was spacious and clean. Our business was in downtown Baltimore and it took about fifteen minutes (by car) to get to our destination near the inner harbor. I recommend this hotel if you don't mind the drive downtown. The price for similar rooms downtown started about 250$ and went up from there. My total at four points was 100 dollars including all taxes and fees. One IMPORTANT note: request a room on the opposite side of the runway! We could hear the planes taking off until abour 1130 pm or so.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay!!...Beware You're on TSA Property!!”
Reviews.Author: AKAstyl
Reviews.Content: My Father and I stayed here the Aug 3-6, 2007 for a family reunion. This is an older property but the remodel was great! The rooms have gold fixtures in the bath and flat screen TVs. The beds were comfy and everything was very clean. Very nice new decor. The layout of the entire hotel is less than desired. It seemed as though the hallways were designed as an afterthought. Somehow they messed up my reservation and they cancelled our room. My bad for not checking up behind them!!! If it were not for the unfortunate events that happened our first night I would have given it a better rating. There were 2 family reunions at the same time, which kept the hotel very busy. Granted, hotel security did a great job at handling it but there was severe overkill when the guard pulled a fire alarm at 2:00am when he thought he smelled cigar smoke coming from a room. Duuuh!! This evacuated the whole hotel and had old and young standing out in the parking lot in rollers and PJs. After the Fire Dept. left, 6 TSA Officers showed up and proceeded to throw out the person whose room it was. The next day, someone was smoking weed in their room (it could be smelled in the hall)and security went knocking on every door pretending to be housekeeping. When no one answered, they proceeded to open each door and see if they could smell anything. (Don't know how legal all this was!?!) They found the culprits called TSA and had them put out. I would definitely stay there again. But, with the knowledge that they are NOT having ANY foolishness!!!

Reviews.Title: “Right next to the airport”
Reviews.Author: chsparkles
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be close to the Baltimore airport to fly out the next morning. We almost didn't stop because of our bad experience at Four Points by Sheraton in Williamsburg, but this looked nice and was so close to the airport. It was very easy to gas up our rental car near by and then return it in the morning just around the corner from the hotel. This was a nice way to end our driving vacation around Virginia. My only complaints would be poor lighting and oversized pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with the amenities at Four Points BWI”
Reviews.Author: czang76
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 4 and 6 year old boys when my husband was in Baltimore on business. We switched to this hotel at the last minute because it was going to be extremely hot and they looked like they had a nice pool area. We were very pleased with our decision. The olypmic-sized pool was very clean and warm and there was an actual lifeguard on duty. As other reviewers mentioned, the staff is very pleasant and knowledgable about the area, with directions on hand to just about everywhere in Baltimore. We also used the convenient and prompt airport van service to catch the light rail system to the inner harbor--my boys thought this was quite an adventure. They even had a children's menu for room service, which I appreciated after a long day of sightseeing with two young boys. Like the other reviewers said, try the crab soup! Great hotel!
